net.proteusframework.core

Class ProxyUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.ProxyUtil

  • public final class ProxyUtil
extends Object
    Simple utility to deal with proxied objects. You must set the setProxyClassRetriever(ProxyClassRetriever) in order to correctly unproxy objects. If this method is not passed a non-null instance then methods here will behave as though no proxies are being used. This can be done in Spring as follows: 

       <bean class="net.proteusframework.core.ProxyUtil" factory-method="getInstance" singleton="true">
      <property name="proxyClassRetriever">
           <bean class="com.i2rd.hibernate.HibernateProxyClassRetriever" factory-method="getInstance" singleton="true /">
       </property>
   </bean>
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com), Kevin Beaty (kbeaty@i2rd.com) for ProxyClassRetriever, Pat Double (double@i2rd.com) moving ProxyClassRetriever here

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ProxyUtil getInstance()
        Get an instance.
        Returns:
        ProxyUtil.

      • getProxiedClass

        public <O> Class<? extends O> getProxiedClass(O instance)
        Get the class that is being proxied. This method calls the equivalent methods in hibernate and spring. If a detached(and proxied) hibernate entity is provided another copy of the entity will be added to the hibernate session as a side-effect of loading the entity to determine the real class.
        Type Parameters:
        O - the type.
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance to check.
        Returns:
        the class being proxied or the specified instance's class if it is not being proxied.

      • setProxyClassRetriever

        public void setProxyClassRetriever(com.i2rd.util.ProxyClassRetriever proxyClassRetriever)
        Sets the proxy class retriever. Due to the singleton behaviour of this class, this retriever is intended to be used per JVM and initialized on the setup of the app (through spring or simlilar technology).
        Parameters:
        proxyClassRetriever - the proxy class retriever to use
